results.title: Heatwave
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Ross Matthews, Hilary Linstead and Heatwave Films Pty Ltd, Sydney Australia F F P A A
results.brief_description: A suspenseful thriller about a woman who cared too much about people, their lives and their homes, and a man who had a job to do and wouldn’t be swayed by emotions. She represented the people, he represented power and corruption and together they were heading towards trouble. Cast includes Judy Davis, Richard Moir, Chris Haywood, Bill Hunter and John Meillon. PLEASE NOTE: THE 16MM PRINT OF THIS FILM HAS NORWEGIAN SUBTITLES

results.title: The Fringe dwellers
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Sue Milliken, Oz Films and Fringe Dwellers Productions
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Nene Gare’s novel about contemporary life among Australian aborigines shows them as outcasts in their own country, despised by the whites, disinclined to work at the menial jobs they can get, and with a big partiality to alcohol. The Comeaway family is persuaded by their 15 year old daughter Trilby to move from the shanty town to a new estate. She is determined not to fall into the same overbreeding, underachieving trap as the women around her, but finds that events conspire against her.

results.title: The Man from Snowy River
results.brief_description: The Man From Snowy River, based on the classic Australian poem by Banjo Patterson, tells the story of an 18 year old boy who proves himself a man during an unforgettable chase on horseback down the rugged Snowy Mountains and becomes a legend. The most magnificent footage of horses ever filmed.

constellations_other.name: The ‘Australian' alps
constellations_other.description: These feature films and documentaries show how stories have been told to lay claim - and reclaim - the land and our national identity.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.title: Man of Flowers
results.brief_description: Norman Kaye won the AFI’s best actor award for this stunning portrayal of Charles Bremer, a strange and sensitive man, whose sensual appreciation of all things beautiful led to his bizarre and erotic relationship with a young bi-sexual named Lisa. “Man of Flowers” is both erotic and richly amusing with a tragic after glow.

results.title: Running on empty
results.creator_credit: John Clark, Mark Egerton, Pom Oliver and Film Corporation of Western Australia
results.brief_description: A young man, Mike, has an obsession with cars and someone else’s girlfriend. The film concentrates on his struggle to win her, and survive the challenge of her mean boyfriend to a series of illegal street races. Cast includes Deborah Conway, Max Cullen and Richard Moir.

results.title: Street Hero
results.brief_description: Vince Colosimo is a young guy living in a world of drugs, illegal gambling and cruising cop cars. The only thing that keeps him above the mire of petty criminals is his music. The guy’s a drummer in a school band. He’s got the chance to improve his status in the local “Mafia” and they’re pushing for a decision, “Vinnie, you either go it alone, or you join us and get on in the world.”

results.title: Grand illusion = La Grande illusion
results.brief_description: Jean Renoir’s classic study of men in war. The German victor and his captive officers in the close proximity of the prison camp become strangely impacted by the ironic contradictions of their situations. A deep respect develops between the German commander and his captive French officer, inter- woven with each other’s obligations to country and fellow-man. Cast includes Erich von Stroheim and Jean Gabin.

results.title: International Velvet
results.brief_description: The sequel to “National Velvet.” This is the moving story of Sarah (Tatum O’Neal) and her intense determination to win the Equestrian Three Day Event Gold Medal at the Olympic Games. Co-starring Christopher Plummer, Anthony Hopkins and Nanette Newman.

results.title: Tom Brown's School Days
results.brief_description: In this marvellous Hollywood version of British public school life, Tom Brown finds life at Rugby brutal, but eventually helps to become a civilising influence for his schoolmates. Immediately on arrival at Rugby, Tom is befriended by a character named East and together they begin the age old battle against the schoolyard bully. This classic novel is a story of courage, survival of the initiation ritual, and the struggle for acceptance.

results.title: Ginger Meggs
results.brief_description: The famous characters of Australia’s most loved comic strip are brought to life in this full-length movie. Tracing the mischievous antics of Ginger Meggs, his friends and foes, the film is a series of vividly visual misadventures as “Meggsie” and his gang create havoc and uproar through their larrikin ways of dodging the law and, more often than not, plunging headfirst into trouble.
